info.game_comments: (Kermit the Frog: Hi-ho, Kermit the Frog here.  Hey, I got a Jeopardy! clue.  This game show features Miss Piggy.  Give up?  What is The Weakest Pork Link?  [...She's not here, is she?])

(1, 1).clue: Orbiting the moon on Christmas Eve 1968, Apollo 8's crew read aloud from this book of the Old Testament

(3, 1).clue: About the book "Outrageous", Charles Barkley said, "I was misquoted"; oddly, it was this type of book

(4, 1).clue: A high-pitched noise could be the pad wear indicator, indicating problems with these pads

(5, 1).clue: An accident at the east end of I-80 will cause rubbernecking in Teaneck in this state

(6, 1).clue: Mary Poppins told us that this amount "of sugar helps the medicine go down in a most delightful way"

(1, 2).clue: Apollo 10's command service module was Charlie Brown; the l.m. had this less talkative co-star's name

(3, 2).clue: 1-word answer given by Houston Rockets coach Tom Nissalke in 1966 when asked how to pronounce his name

(4, 2).clue: (Sofia of the Clue Crew working on a race car.) I'm checking for this dangerous & messy problem which ended Jeff Gordon's Daytona 500 bid in 2000

(5, 2).clue: If Meredith Willson had taken the I-90 route, the song might have been "South Bend, Indiana" instead of this on I-80

(6, 2).clue: On TV George Lindsey played this cousin of Gomer Pyle

(1, 3).clue: This last Apollo lunar mission has the same number as a movie "Stalag"

(3, 3).clue: Saying how well he & an L.A. Laker teammate worked together this "prestidigitator" said, "It's almost like we have ESPN"

(4, 3).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew in a race car.) At the 1998 Brickyard 400 this happened to Dale Jarrett's car, helping Jeff Gordon to win the race

(5, 3).clue: This city on I-80 is home to the University of Osteopathic Medicine & more Iowans than anywhere else

(6, 3).clue: A light, good-hearted satire, or a "National" magazine that does satire

(1, 4).clue: He circled the moon in Apollo 8 & later headed Eastern Airlines

(3, 4).clue: A coach for this Tallahassee-based college football team directed, "You guys line up alphabetically by height"

(4, 4).clue: A clunking sound may mean trouble with the u (for universal) or cv (for constant velocity) one of these

(5, 4).clue: The Mandalay Resort Group has Circus Circus properties in Vegas & in this city on I-80

(6, 4).clue: As a verb, it means to bend over & down from the waist; as a noun, it's a small porch

(1, 5).clue: This third man on the moon did an American Express ad in 1975

(3, 5).clue: Asked if he'd seen this temple on the Acropolis, Shaq said, "I can't...remember the names of the clubs we went to"

(4, 5).clue: (Sofia of the Clue Crew waving a flag.) It's a synonym for care or another name for the yellow flag in auto racing

(5, 5).clue: Be sure to wear some flowers in your hair when you hit this city, the western end of I-80

(6, 5).clue: In "Gulliver's Travels", they're the savage servants of a race of noble horses called Houyhnhnms

(1, 1).clue: The Ludus Magnus was a training school for these, who were to perform in the Colosseum

(2, 1).clue: "Hakuna Matata" was 1 of 3 tunes nominated for Best Song from this Disney film

(3, 1).clue: When this "Paul Revere's Ride" author was born in what's now Portland, Maine, the city was part of Massachusetts

(4, 1).clue: "The joker ain't the only fool who'll do anything for you" is a line from this Juice Newton hit

(5, 1).clue: The university of this Canadian province has branches in Abitibi-Temiscamingue, Chicoutimi & Trois-Rivieres

(6, 1).clue: An oxen harness made from the center of an egg

(1, 2).clue: Aristotle guessed correctly that this river's annual floods were caused by rains in Ethiopia

(2, 2).clue: (Kermit the Frog sits at a desk.)  In 1979 I had a Top 40 hit with this song from "The Muppet Movie"

(3, 2).clue: His preface to the play "Saint Joan" says, "Not one of Joan's comrades...ever claimed that she was pretty"

(4, 2).clue: In Carroll's Wonderland, he presided over the trial of a tart thief

(5, 2).clue: Founded in 1579, the University of Vilnius is this country's oldest university

(1, 3).clue: Caligula & Hadrian were among the tourists who visited this Sicilian volcano

(2, 3).clue: (Harry Connick Jr. in front of a Jeopardy! background.) My first multiplatinum album was the soundtrack to this 1989 Billy Crystal film

(3, 3).clue: (Jeff Probst in the Marquesas.) In 1888 this adventure author & his wife Fanny spent about three weeks on Nuku Hiva

(4, 3).clue: Nickname of Cecil Rhodes or Harry Winston

(5, 3).clue: Adirondack Community College is a 2-year school in Queensbury in this U.S. state

(6, 3).clue: The least good type of sausage

(1, 4).clue: Titus Tatius was the king of these people who attacked Rome after the abduction of their women

(2, 4).clue: He had a 1994 hit with "Streets of Philadelphia", from a Tom Hanks film

(3, 4).clue: In 1917, after almost 30 years in love with Maud Gonne, this Irish poet proposed to her daughter

(4, 4).clue: In a romantic dance hit of 1986, Stacey Q cut to this card in the deck

(5, 4).clue: In 1963 Oral Roberts founded a university in this city & named it for himself

(1, 5).clue: In 31 B.C., Mark Antony's army camped on this cape before his battle with Octavian off its gulf

(2, 5).clue: Berry Gordy directed this 1975 film whose theme song was Diana Ross' "Do You Know Where You're Going To?"

(3, 5).clue: A rhyme says he, "by a mighty effort of will, overcame his...bonhomie & wrote 'Principles of Political Economy'"

(5, 5).clue: They're the adjectives A&M originally stood for in the name of Texas A&M

(6, 5).clue: A bench-mounted clamp to hold a bad habit

(0, 0).clue: When Washington took office on April 30, 1789, it was the largest state in area, covering what is now 3 states
